children.subject: Thank you! and Thank you to student answer responder!

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/A_re-introduction_to_JavaScript

The best way to learn any language is to use it, so I'd recommend coding a project in JS after reading the documentation.

history.content:
I would highly recommend the free JavaScript course on Code Academy, at least to build a starting foundation. It can be breezed through fairly quickly and it isn't particularly rigorous, but it will help you establish a set of very basic skills and give you an initial, easy to approach schematic for learning the language.

Once you're comfortable with the simpler aspects of the language, the best way to learn from there is to work on a project yourself. I would recommend that you host a web page locally (most easily done through the command "python -m http.server") and make an app that you're interested in (maybe an interactive profile page or a super simple click-based game). Embrace the heavy bias that good JavaScript code has towards Object Oriented Programming and feel free to explore preexisting libraries that will make your job easier. Try starting out with a skeleton of an HTML file and learning some basic HTML and CSS along the way to add flare and personality to this web page that you'll be building.

Best of luck!

Tons of resources online, does anyone have one they did that was really good? I plan on getting a solid foundation in JavaScript, then I'll learn the frameworks after.
history.subject: Recommended Free Tutorial for JavaScript?
